entry.title: Code.org: What most schools don't teach
entry.content:
The programmers of tomorrow are the wizards of the future. You're going to look like you have magic powers...

- Gabe Newell, Founder of Valve

Code.org just launched with the vision that every student in every school should have the opportunity to learn how to code as well as a film encouraging every student to do so.

I'm grateful to have contributed to this inspiring short film by Lesley Chilcott, producer of Waiting for Superman, alongside Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates, Bronwen Grimes, Chris Bosh, Will.I.Am, Elena Silenok, Jack Dorsey, Drew Houston, Ruchi Sanghvi, and other oustanding people.

If you're a teacher, know a teacher, sit next to a teacher on the subway, or otherwise have means to spread the word, please do so! No one is too old or too... anything, really, to learn how to code. There are several lengths and versions of the film available, and you can start learning to code right away.

Once you're ready, we'll be thrilled to have you improve the world by contributing to social good coding projects at CodeMontage.

entry.title: ThinkUp Setup: Get better at coding AND social networking
entry.content:
In typical developer style, I just spent several hours hacking on something only to find a totally different way to accomplish the same thing in about ten minutes.

The short version of setting up ThinkUp app was pretty phenomenally easy:

  1. Create a free account with a free plan on AppFog
  2. Use Launcher.io's ThinkUp Jumpstart one-click install (golden!) to deploy to AppFog
  3. Upgrade ThinkUp as prompted in your navigation bar
  4. Update Settings > Account > Enable beta upgrades so you can get the snazzy 2.0 beta
  5. Upgrade ThinkUp as prompted in your navigation bar (again)
  6. Add social media accounts in the plugins section
  7. Clear your browser's cache
  8. Rock and roll

I'm intrigued by ThinkUp for a few reasons:

  1. It's open source!
  2. It has a community that first identifies itself as friendly
  3. It has analytics! based on data!
  4. Its core codebase was written by one of my favorite developer-founders, Gina Trapani
  5. Anil Dash, Gina's co-founder, is one of the best twitter users I know (seriously, did you see this tweet?)

Looking forward to seeing how this goes :)
